member.name: E:FastReport.BandBase.BeforeLayout
member.summary: This event occurs before the band layouts its child objects.

member.summary: This event occurs after the child objects layout was finished.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.StartNewPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the band should be printed from a new page.
member.remarks: New page is not generated when printing very first group or data row. This is made to avoid empty first page.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.FirstRowStartsNewPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the first row can start a new report page.
member.remarks: Use this property if is set to true. Normally the new page is not started when printing the first data row, to avoid empty first page.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.PrintOnBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the band should be printed on the page bottom.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.KeepChild
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the band should be printed together with its child band.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.OutlineExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets an outline expression.

remarks.para: Outline is a tree control displayed in the preview window. It represents the prepared report structure. Each outline node can be clicked to navigate to the item in the prepared report.

To create the outline, set this property to any valid expression that represents the outline node text. This expression will be calculated when band is about to print, and its value will be added to the outline. Thus, nodes' hierarchy in the outline is similar to the bands' hierarchy in a report. That means there will be the main and subordinate outline nodes, corresponding to the main and subordinate bands in a report (a report with two levels of data or with groups can exemplify the point).

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Child
member.summary: Gets or sets a child band that will be printed right after this band.
member.remarks: Typical use of child band is to print several objects that can grow or shrink. It also can be done using the shift feature (via property), but in some cases it's not possible.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Objects
member.summary: Gets a collection of report objects belongs to this band.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Repeated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that band is reprinted on a new page.
member.remarks: This property is applicable to the DataHeaderBand and GroupHeaderBand only. It returns true if its RepeatOnAllPages property is true and band is reprinted on a new page.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.BeforeLayoutEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a script event name that will be fired before the band layouts its child objects.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.AfterLayoutEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a script event name that will be fired after the child objects layout was finished.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.Guides
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of guide lines for this band.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.RowNo
member.summary: Gets a row number (the same value returned by the "Row#" system variable).
member.remarks:
This property can be used when running a report. It may be useful to print hierarchical row numbers in a master-detail report, like this:
1.1
1.2
2.1
2.2
To do this, put the Text object on a detail data band with the following text in it:
[Data1.RowNo].[Data2.RowNo]

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.AbsRowNo
member.summary: Gets an absolute row number (the same value returned by the "AbsRow#" system variable).

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.IsFirstRow
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that this is the first data row.

member.name: P:FastReport.BandBase.IsLastRow
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that this is the last data row.

member.summary: This method fires the AfterLayout event and the script code connected to the AfterLayoutEvent.

member.name: T:FastReport.Barcode.BarcodeMaxiCode
member.summary: Generates the 2D MaxiCode barcode.

member.name: P:FastReport.Barcode.BarcodeMaxiCode.Mode
member.summary: Sets the MaxiCode mode to use. Only modes 2 to 6 are supported.

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.BarcodeMaxiCode.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

members.member:
Implements MaxiCode according to ISO 16023:2000.
MaxiCode employs a pattern of hexagons around a central 'bulls-eye' finder pattern. Encoding in several modes is supported, but encoding in Mode 2 and 3 require primary messages to be set. Input characters can be any from the ISO 8859-1 (Latin-1) character set.
TODO: Add ECI functionality.
@author Robin Stuart @author Daniel Gredler
MaxiCode module sequence, from ISO/IEC 16023 Figure 5 (30 x 33 data grid).
ASCII character to Code Set mapping, from ISO/IEC 16023 Appendix A. 1 = Set A, 2 = Set B, 3 = Set C, 4 = Set D, 5 = Set E. 0 refers to special characters that fit into more than one set (e.g. GS).
ASCII character to symbol value, from ISO/IEC 16023 Appendix A.

Sets the MaxiCode mode to use. Only modes 2 to 6 are supported.
@param mode the MaxiCode mode to use

Returns the MaxiCode mode being used. Only modes 2 to 6 are supported.
@return the MaxiCode mode being used

If this MaxiCode symbol is part of a series of MaxiCode symbols appended in a structured format, this method sets the total number of symbols in the series. Valid values are 1 through 8 inclusive. A value of 1 indicates that this symbol is not part of a structured append series.
@param total the total number of MaxiCode symbols in the structured append series

Sets the primary data. Should only be used for modes 2 and 3. Must conform to the following structure:
CharactersMeaning
1-9Postal code data which can consist of up to 9 digits (for mode 2) or up to 6 alphanumeric characters (for mode 3). Remaining unused characters should be filled with the SPACE character (ASCII 32).
10-12Three-digit country code according to ISO-3166.
13-15Three digit service code. This depends on your parcel courier.
@param primary the primary data

Returns the primary data for this MaxiCode symbol. Should only be used for modes 2 and 3.
@return the primary data for this MaxiCode symbol
{@inheritDoc}

Formats text according to Appendix A, populating the {@link #set} and {@link #character} arrays.
@return true if the content fits in this symbol and was formatted; false otherwise
{@inheritDoc}
{@inheritDoc}

member.name: T:FastReport.Barcode.BarcodeObject
member.summary: Represents a barcode object.
member.remarks:
The instance of this class represents a barcode. Here are some common actions that can be performed with this object:
To select the type of barcode, use the property.
To specify a static barcode data, use the property. You also may use the or properties to specify dynamic value for a barcode.
To set a barcode orientation, use the property.
To specify the size of barcode, set the property to true and use the property to zoom the barcode. If property is set to false, you need to specify the size using the Width and Height properties.

member.summary: Gets or sets the barcode type.

member.name: P:FastReport.Barcode.BarcodeObject.SymbologyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the symbology name.
member.remarks:
The following symbology names are supported:
"2/5 Interleaved"
"2/5 Industrial"
"2/5 Matrix"
"Codabar"
"Code128"
"Code39"
"Code39 Extended"
"Code93"
"Code93 Extended"
"EAN8"
"EAN13"
"MSI"
"PostNet"
"UPC-A"
"UPC-E0"
"UPC-E1"
"Supplement 2"
"Supplement 5"
"PDF417"
"Datamatrix"
"QRCode"

summary.p: Represents a 2D matrix of bits. In function arguments below, and throughout the common module, x is the column position, and y is the row position. The ordering is always x, y. The origin is at the top-left.
Internally the bits are represented in a 1-D array of 32-bit ints. However, each row begins with a new int. This is done intentionally so that we can copy out a row into a BitArray very efficiently.
The ordering of bits is row-major. Within each int, the least significant bits are used first, meaning they represent lower x values. This is compatible with BitArray's implementation.

summary.p: This class contains utility methods for performing mathematical operations over the Galois Fields. Operations use a given primitive polynomial in calculations.
Throughout this package, elements of the GF are represented as an {@code int} for convenience and speed (but at the cost of memory).

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.GenericGF.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a representation of GF(size) using the given primitive polynomial.
member.param: irreducible polynomial whose coefficients are represented by * the bits of an int, where the least-significant bit represents the constant * coefficient
the factor b in the generator polynomial can be 0- or 1-based * (g(x) = (x+a^b)(x+a^(b+1))...(x+a^(b+2t-1))). * In most cases it should be 1, but for QR code it is 0.

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.GenericGF.buildMonomial(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Builds the monomial.

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.GenericGF.addOrSubtract(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Implements both addition and subtraction -- they are the same in GF(size).

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.GenericGF.exp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Exps the specified a.
member.returns: 2 to the power of a in GF(size)

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.GenericGF.log(System.Int32)
member.summary: Logs the specified a.
member.returns: base 2 log of a in GF(size)

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.GenericGF.inverse(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inverses the specified a.

member.name: M:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.GenericGF.multiply(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplies the specified a with b.
member.returns: product of a and b in GF(size)

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

summary.p: Represents a polynomial whose coefficients are elements of a GF. Instances of this class are immutable.

member.name: T:FastReport.Barcode.Aztec.HighLevelEncoder
member.summary: This produces nearly optimal encodings of text into the first-level of encoding used by Aztec code. It uses a dynamic algorithm. For each prefix of the string, it determines a set of encodings that could lead to this prefix. We repeatedly add a character and generate a new set of optimal encodings until we have read through the entire input. @author Frank Yellin @author Rustam Abdullaev

member.returns: text represented by this encoder encoded as a

member.name: T:FastReport.Base
member.summary: Represents the root class of the FastReport object's hierarhy.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is selected in the designer.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsParentSelected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether one of the object's parent is selected in the designer.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the object in the designer.

remarks.para: This method is called when you delete the object in the designer.
Typically this method calls the method to delete the object and all its children. You may override it to delete the object only, and keep children.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.OnBeforeInsert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called before inserting a new object in the designer.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You may override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.OnAfterInsert(FastReport.InsertFrom)
member.summary: Called after the new object was inserted in the designer.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You may override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.

This method is called when new object is inserted, pasted from clipboard or dragged from "Dictionary" window. You may override this method if you need to perform some actions when object is inserted. Typical implementation invokes the object's editor if "Edit after insert" flag is set in the designer options.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Called when the user selects another object in the designer.
member.remarks: This method is typically used by the in-place object's editor to check if selection was changed and close the editor.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.GetContextMenu
member.summary: Gets the object's context menu.
member.returns: Null reference if object does not have a menu.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You may override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.
You may use base menu classes such as , to create own context menus.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object.

remarks.para: Name of the report object must contain alpha, digit, underscore symbols only. Data objects such as Variable, TableDataSource etc. can have any characters in they names. Each component must have unique name.

member.example:
The following code demonstrates how to find an object by its name:
TextObject text1 = report1.FindObject("Text1") as TextObject;
member.exception: Another object with such name exists.
Rename an object that was introduced in the ancestor report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Restrictions
member.summary: Gets or sets the flags that restrict some actions in the designer.
member.remarks: Use this property to restrict some user actions like move, resize, edit, delete. For example, if Restriction.DontMove flag is set, user cannot move the object in the designer.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Flags
member.summary: Gets the flags that allow some functionality in the designer.
member.remarks: Use this property only if you developing a new FastReport object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the object.

remarks.para: Each report object must have a parent in order to appear in the report. Parent must be able to contain objects of such type.

member.exception: Parent object cannot contain this object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.BaseName
member.summary: The base part of the object's name.
member.remarks: This property is used to automatically create unique object's name. See

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.ClassName
member.summary: Gets the short type name.
member.remarks: Returns the short type name, such as "TextObject".

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Report
member.summary: Gets reference to the parent object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.Page
member.summary: Gets reference to the parent object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.ChildObjects
member.summary: Gets the collection of this object's child objects.
member.remarks: This property returns child objects that belongs to this object. For example, Report.ChildObjects will return only pages that contains in the report, but not page childs such as bands. To return all child objects, use property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.AllObjects
member.summary: Gets the collection of all child objects.
member.remarks: This property returns child objects that belongs to this object and to child objects of this object. For example, Report.AllObjects will return all objects that contains in the report - such as pages, bands, text objects.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.ZOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the Z-order of the object.
member.remarks: The Z-order is also called "creation order". It is the index of an object in the parent's objects list. For example, put two text objects on a band. First object will have ZOrder = 0, second = 1. Setting the second object's ZOrder to 0 will move it to the back of the first text object.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsAncestor

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsPrinting
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is currently printing.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is currently processed by the report engine.

member.name: P:FastReport.Base.OriginalComponent
member.summary: Gets an original component for this object.
member.remarks: This property is used in the preview mode. Each object in the prepared report is bound to its original (from the report template). This technique is used to minimize the prepared report's size.

member.summary: Helper method, helps to set a reference-type value to the property.
member.remarks: This method is used widely to set a new value to the property that references another FastReport object. Method deals with the property.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.FloatDiff(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Checks if two float values are different.
member.returns: true if values are not equal.
member.remarks: This method is needed to compare two float values using some precision (0.001). It is useful to compare objects' locations and sizes for equality.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.DeserializeSubItems(FastReport.Utils.FRReader)
member.summary: Deserializes nested object properties.

remarks.para: Typically the object serializes all properties to the single xml item:
Some objects like have child objects that serialized in subitems:
remarks.code: <DataBand Name="Data1" Top="163" Width="718.2" Height="18.9"> <TextObject Name="Text3" Left="18.9" Top="37.8" Width="283.5" Height="28.35"/> </DataBand>
remarks.para: To read such subitems, the DeserializeSubItems method is used. Base implementation reads the child objects. You may override it to read some specific subitems.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.ExtractDefaultMacros(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the macros in the given string and returns the new string.
member.returns: The text with macros replaced with its values.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetFlags(FastReport.Flags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set object's flags.
member.param: true to set the flag, false to reset.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetReport(FastReport.Report)
member.summary: Sets the reference to a Report.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetName(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the object's name.
member.remarks: This method is for internal use only. It just sets a new name without any checks (unlike the property setter).

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetParent(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Sets the object's parent.
member.remarks: This method is for internal use only. You can use it if you are developing a new component for FastReport. Override it to perform some actions when the parent of an object is changing. This method checks that parent can contain a child.
member.exception: Parent object cannot contain this object.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.SetParentCore(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Sets the object's parent.
member.remarks: This method is for internal use only. You can use it if you are developing a new component for FastReport. This method does not perform any checks, it just sets the new parent.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.FindObject(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for an object with given name.
member.param: Name of the object to find.
member.returns: Returns a null reference if object is not found

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.CreateUniqueName
member.summary: Creates the unique object's name.

remarks.para: Note: you have to set object's parent before calling this method. Method uses the property to create a name.
Note: this method may be very slow on a report that contains lots of objects. Consider using own naming logic in this case.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Clear
member.summary: Clears the object's state.
member.remarks: This method also disposes all object's children.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Serialize(FastReport.Utils.FRWriter)
member.summary: Serializes the object.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You should override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.
This method is called when the object needs to save the state. It may happen when:

item.description: saving the report to the file or stream;
saving the report to the designer's undo buffer;
assigning the object to another object using the or AssignAll methods;
saving the object to the designer's clipboard;
saving the object to the preview (when run a report).

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Deserialize(FastReport.Utils.FRReader)
member.summary: Deserializes the object.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You should override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.
This method is called when the object needs to restore the state. It may happen when:

item.description: loading the report from a file or stream;
loading the report from the designer's undo buffer;
assigning another object to this object using the or AssignAll methods;
loading the object from the designer's clipboard;

list.item: loading the object from the preview pages.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.BaseAssign(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Assigns values from another source.
member.remarks: Note: this method is relatively slow because it serializes an object to the xml and then deserializes it.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.Assign(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Copies the contents of another, similar object.

remarks.para: Call Assign to copy the properties from another object of the same type. The standard form of a call to Assign is
which tells the destination object to copy the contents of the source object to itself. In this method, all child objects are ignored. If you want to copy child objects, use the AssignAll method.

member.param: Source object to copy the contents from.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.AssignAll(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Copies the contents (including children) of another, similar object.

remarks.para: This method is similar to method. It copies child objects as well.

member.param: Source object to copy the state from.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.HasParent(FastReport.Base)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object has the specified parent in its parent hierarhy.
member.returns: Returns true if the object has given parent in its parent hierarhy.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.HasFlag(FastReport.Flags)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object has a specified flag in its property.
member.returns: true if Flags property contains specified flag.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.HasRestriction(FastReport.Restrictions)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object has a specified restriction in its property.
member.returns: true if Restrictions property contains specified restriction.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.InvokeEvent(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes script event.
member.param: Name of the event to invoke.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You should use it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.
Use this method to call an event handler that is located in the report's script.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.OnAfterLoad
member.summary: Called after all report objects were loaded.
member.remarks: Do not call this method directly. You may override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.GetExpressions
member.summary: Gets all expressions contained in the object.
member.returns: Array of expressions or null if object contains no expressions.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly. You may override it if you are developing a new component for FastReport.

This method is called by FastReport each time before run a report. FastReport do this to collect all expressions and compile them. For example, GetExpressions method of the class parses the text and returns all expressions found in the text.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.GetCustomScript
member.summary: Returns a custom code that will be added to the report script before report is run.
member.returns: A custom script text, if any. Otherwise returns null.

remarks.para: This method may return any valid code that may be inserted into the report script. Currently it is used in the TableObject to define the following script methods: Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Count.
Note: you must take into account the current script language - C# or VB.Net. You may check it via Report.ScriptLanguage property.

member.name: M:FastReport.Base.ExtractMacros
member.summary: Used to extract macros such as "TotalPages#" in the preview mode.
member.remarks: This method is used mainly by the TextObject to extract macros and replace it with actual values passed in the pageIndex and totalPages parameters. This method is called automatically when the object is being previewed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Base class with default settings.

member.name: T:FastReport.CellularTextObject
member.summary: Represents a text object which draws each symbol of text in its own cell.
member.remarks:
The text may be aligned to left or right side, or centered. Use the property to do this. The "justify" align is not supported now, as well as vertical alignment.
The cell size is defined in the and properties. These properties are 0 by default, in this case the size of cell is calculated automatically based on the object's Font.
To define a spacing (gap) between cells, use the and properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.CellularTextObject.CellWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of cell, in pixels.
member.remarks: If zero width and/or height specified, the object will calculate the cell size automatically based on its font.

member.name: P:FastReport.CellularTextObject.CellHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of cell, in pixels.
member.remarks: If zero width and/or height specified, the object will calculate the cell size automatically based on its font.

member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal spacing between cells, in pixels.

member.name: T:FastReport.ChildBand
member.summary: This class represents a child band.
member.remarks: Typical use of child band is to print several objects that can grow or shrink. It also can be done using the shift feature (via property), but in some cases it's not possible.

member.name: P:FastReport.ChildBand.FillUnusedSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that band will be used to fill unused space on a page.
member.remarks: If you set this property to true, the band will be printed several times to fill unused space on a report page.

member.name: P:FastReport.ChildBand.CompleteToNRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the overall number of data rows printed by the data band.
member.remarks: Using this property, you may complete the data band upto N data rows. If the data band has less number of rows, this band will be used to print empty rows.

member.name: P:FastReport.ChildBand.PrintIfDatabandEmpty
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the band will be printed if its parent databand is empty.
member.remarks: The child band with this property set to true, connected to a databand can be used to print "No data" text if the databand has no rows.

member.name: T:FastReport.ComponentBase
member.summary: Class that implements some object's properties such as location, size and visibility.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.GetSelectionPoints
member.summary: Gets the object's selection points.

remarks.para: Selection point is a small square displayed at the object's sides when object is selected in the designer. You can drag this square by the mouse to change the object's size. For example, the TextObject has eight selection points to change its width and height by the mouse.

If you are developing a new component for FastReport, you may override this method if your object has non-standard set of selection points. For example, if an object has something like "AutoSize" property, it would be good to disable all selection points if that property is true, to disable resizing of the object by the mouse.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.DrawSelectionPoint(FastReport.Utils.FRPaintEventArgs,System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.Brush,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws the selection point.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.PointInSelectionPoint(System.Single,System.Single,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that given point is inside selection point.
member.returns: true if (x,y) is inside the point

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.PointInObject(System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Checks if given point is inside the object's bounds.
member.returns: true if point is inside the object's bounds.
member.remarks: You can override this method if your objectis not of rectangular form.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.CheckParent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the object is inside its parent.
member.param: if true, check now independent of any conditions.

remarks.para: Typically you don't need to use or override this method.

When you move an object with the mouse, it may be moved outside its parent. If so, this method must find a new parent for the object and correct it's Left, Top and Parent properties. If immediately parameter is false, you can optimize the method to search for new parent only if the object's bounds are outside parent. If this parameter is true, you must skip any optimizations and search for a parent immediately.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.CheckNegativeSize(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Corrects the object's size and sizing point if the size becomes negative.
member.para: Typically you don't need to use or override this method.

This method is called by the FastReport designer to check if the object's size becomes negative when resizing the object by the mouse. Method must correct the object's size and/or position to make it positive, also change the sizing point if needed.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.GetPreferredSize
member.summary: Gets the preferred size of an object.
member.remarks: This method is called by the FastReport designer when you insert a new object.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.DrawSelection(FastReport.Utils.FRPaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Draw the selection points.
member.remarks: This method draws a set of selection points returned by the method.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.DrawDragAcceptFrame(FastReport.Utils.FRPaintEventArgs,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Draw the frame around the object to indicate that it accepts the drag&drop operation.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleMouseDown(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles MouseDown event that occurs when the user clicks the mouse in the designer.

remarks.para: This method is called when the user press the mouse button in the designer. The standard implementation does the following:

list.item: checks if the mouse pointer is inside the object;
add an object to the selected objects list of the designer;
sets the e.Handled flag to true.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleMouseHover(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles MouseMove event that occurs when the user moves the mouse in the designer.

remarks.para: This method is called when the user moves the mouse in the designer. Typical use of this method is to change the mouse cursor to SizeAll when it is over an object. The standard implementation does the following:

list.item: checks if the mouse pointer is inside the object;
sets the e.Handled flag to true.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleMouseMove(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles MouseMove event that occurs when the user moves the mouse in the designer.

remarks.para: This method is called when the user moves the mouse in the designer. The standard implementation does the following:

list.item: if mouse button is not pressed, check that mouse pointer is inside one of the selection points returned by the method and set the e.SizingPoint member to the corresponding sizing point;
if mouse button is pressed, and e.SizingPoint member is not SizingPoint.None, resize the object.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleMouseUp(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles MouseUp event that occurs when the user releases the mouse button in the designer.

remarks.para: This method is called when the user releases the mouse button in the designer. The standard implementation does the following:

list.item: if e.Mode is WorkspaceMode2.SelectionRect, checks if object is inside the selection rectangle and sets e.Handled flag if so;
checks that object is inside its parent (calls the method).

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleDoubleClick
member.summary: Handles double click event in the designer.
member.remarks: This method is called when the user doubleclicks the object in the designer. Typical implementation invokes the object's editor (calls the InvokeEditor method) and sets the designer's Modified flag.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleMouseWheel(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles mouse wheel event.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleDragOver(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the DragOver event in the designer.
member.remarks: This method is called when the user drags an item from the Data Tree window. This method should check that the mouse (e.X, e.Y) is inside the object, then set the e.Handled flag to true if an item can be dragged into this object.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleDragDrop(FastReport.Utils.FRMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the DragDrop event in the designer.
member.remarks: This method is called when the user drops an item from the Data Tree window into this object. This method should copy the information from the e.DraggedObject object and set the e.Handled flag to true to complete the drag operation.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.HandleKeyDown(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles KeyDown event in the designer.
member.remarks: This method is called when the user presses any key in the designer. Typical implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.GetSmartTag
member.summary: Returns a "smart tag" menu.
member.remarks: "Smart tag" is a little button that appears near the object's top-right corner when we are in the designer and move the mouse over the object. When you click that button you will see a popup window where you can set up some properties of the object. FastReport uses smart tags to quickly choose the datasource (for a band) or data column (for objects).

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the left coordinate of the object in relation to its container.

remarks.para: This property value is measured in the screen pixels. Use class to convert a value to desired units.
To obtain absolute coordinate, use property.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the top coordinate of the object in relation to its container.

remarks.para: This property value is measured in the screen pixels. Use class to convert a value to desired units.
To obtain absolute coordinate, use property.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the object.
member.remarks: This property value is measured in the screen pixels. Use class to convert a value to desired units.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the object.
member.remarks: This property value is measured in the screen pixels. Use class to convert a value to desired units.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Dock
member.summary: Gets or sets which control borders are docked to its parent control and determines how a control is resized with its parent.

remarks.para: Use the Dock property to define how a control is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. For example, setting Dock to DockStyle.Left causes the control to align itself with the left edges of its parent control and to resize as the parent control is resized.
A control can be docked to one edge of its parent container or can be docked to all edges and fill the parent container.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Anchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the edges of the container to which a control is bound and determines how a control is resized with its parent.

remarks.para: Use the Anchor property to define how a control is automatically resized as its parent control is resized. Anchoring a control to its parent control ensures that the anchored edges remain in the same position relative to the edges of the parent control when the parent control is resized.

You can anchor a control to one or more edges of its container. For example, if you have a band with a TextObject whose Anchor property value is set to Top, Bottom, the TextObject is stretched to maintain the anchored distance to the top and bottom edges of the band as the height of the band is increased.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the object is displayed in the preview window.
member.remarks: Setting this property to false will hide the object in the preview window.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the Tag string for this component.

member.name: P:FastReport.ComponentBase.GroupIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets a group index.

member.name: M:FastReport.ComponentBase.Draw(FastReport.Utils.FRPaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Draws the object.

remarks.para: This method is widely used in the FastReport. It is called each time when the object needs to draw or print itself.
In order to draw the object correctly, you should multiply the object's bounds by the scale parameter.

cache parameter is used to optimize the drawing speed. It holds all items such as pens, fonts, brushes, string formats that was used before. If the item with requested parameters exists in the cache, it will be returned (instead of create new item and then dispose it).

member.remarks:
The class is used to define one header element of the CrossView (either the column element or row element).
To set visual appearance of the element, use the property.
The collection of descriptors used to represent the CrossView header is stored in the CrossViewObject.Data.Columns and CrossViewObject.Data.Rows properties.

member.summary: Represents a datasource based on DataTable class.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.TableDataSource.Table
member.summary: Gets or sets the underlying DataTable object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the table name.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.TableDataSource.SelectCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets SQL "select" command.
member.remarks: If this command contains parameters, you should specify them in the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.TableDataSource.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a collection of parameters used by "select" command.
member.remarks:
You must set up this property if the SQL query that you've specified in the property contains parameters.
You can pass a value to the SQL parameter in two ways.
The right way is to define a report parameter. You can do this in the "Data" window. Once you have defined the parameter, you can use it to pass a value to the SQL parameter. To do this, set the SQL parameter's Expression property to the report parameter's name (so it will look like [myReportParam]). To pass a value to the report parameter from your application, use the method.
The other way (unrecommended) is to find a datasource object and set its parameter from a code:
TableDataSource ds = report.GetDataSource("My DataSource Name") as TableDataSource; ds.Parameters[0].Value = 10;
This way is not good because you hardcode the report object's name.

member.summary: Gets a string that will identify a connection in the Data Wizard.
member.returns: The string that contains the connection type and some meaningful information.

member.summary: Gets the default type for a new parameter.
member.returns: The integer representation of a parameter type.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.TestConnection
member.summary: Tests the connection.
member.remarks: If test connection is not successful, this method throws an exception. Catch this exception to show an error message.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetEditor
member.summary: Gets a control that will be used to edit the connection properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.DataSet
member.summary: Gets an internal DataSet object that contains all data tables.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.Tables
member.summary: Gets a collection of data tables in this connection.
member.remarks: To add a table to the connection, you must either create a new TableDataSource and add it to this collection or call the method which will add all tables available in the database.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets a connection string that contains all connection parameters.

remarks.para: To modify some parameter of the connection, use respective ConnectionStringBuilder class.

Security note: the connection string may contain a user name/password. This information is stored in a report file. By default, it is crypted using the standard FastReport's password. Since FastReport's source code is available to anyone who paid for it, it may be insecure to use the standard password. For more security, you should use own password. To do this, specify it in the Crypter.DefaultPassword property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.ConnectionStringExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets an expression that returns a connection string.
member.remarks:
Use this property to set the connection string dynamically.
The recommended way to do this is to define a report parameter. You can do this in the "Data" window. Once you have defined the parameter, you can use it to pass a value to the connection. Set the ConnectionStringExpression property of the connection object to the report parameter's name (so it will look like [myReportParam]). To pass a value to the report parameter from your application, use the method.
Once you set value for this property, the property will be ignored when report is run.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.IsSqlBased
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicates if this connection is SQL-based.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.LoginPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a login dialog appears immediately before opening a connection.
member.remarks:
Set LoginPrompt to true to provide login dialog when establishing a connection. If this property is false (by default), you should provide login information (user name and password) in the property. Though that property is stored in a crypted form, this may be insecure.
Another way to pass login information to the connection is to use property that is bound to the report parameter. In that case you supply the entire connection string from your application.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the command timeout, in seconds.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.CreateDataSet
member.summary: Initializes a DataSet instance.
member.remarks: This method is used to support FastReport infrastructure. You don't need to use it.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.DisposeDataSet
member.summary: Disposes a DataSet.
member.remarks: This method is used to support FastReport infrastructure. You don't need to use it.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.SetConnectionString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the connection string.
member.remarks: Use this method if you need to perform some actions when the connection string is set.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetConnectionStringWithLoginInfo(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a connection string that contains username and password specified.
member.remarks: Override this method to pass login information to the connection. Typical implementation must get the existing , merge specified login information into it and return the new value.

member.param: Set to true to initialize each table's schema.

member.summary: Creates the relations between tables. Applies to XmlDataConnection only.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetTableNames
member.summary: Gets an array of table names available in the database.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetConnectionType
member.summary: Returns a type of connection.
member.remarks:
You should override this method if you developing a new connection component.
If your connection component does not use data connection, you need to override the and methods instead.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetConnection
member.summary: Returns a connection object.
member.remarks: Either creates a new DbConnection instance of type provided by the method, or returns the application connection if set in the Config.DesignerSettings.ApplicationConnection.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.OpenConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)
member.summary: Opens a specified connection object.
member.remarks:
Use this method to open a connection returned by the method.
This method displays a login dialog if your connection has the property set to true. Once you have entered an user name and password in this dialog, it will remeber the entered values and will not used anymore in this report session.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.DisposeConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)
member.summary: Disposes a connection.

member.summary: Returns a object that is specific to this connection.
member.param: The SQL command used to fetch a table data rows.
member.remarks:
You should override this method if you are developing a new connection component. In this method, you need to create the adapter and set its SelectCommand's parameters.
If your connection does not use data adapter, you need to override the and methods instead.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataConnectionBase.GetParameterType
member.summary: Gets the type of parameter that is specific to this connection.
member.remarks: This property is used in the report designer to display available data types when you edit the connection parameters. For example, the type of OleDbConnection parameter is a OleDbType.

member.summary: Returns data row number inside the group. This value is reset at the start of a new group.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.AbsRowVariable
member.summary: Returns absolute number of data row. This value is never reset at the start of a new group.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.PageMacroVariable
member.summary:
Returns current page number.
This variable is actually a macro. Its value is substituted when the component is viewed in the preview window. That means you cannot use it in an expression.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.TotalPagesMacroVariable
member.summary:
Returns the number of total pages in the report.
This variable is actually a macro. Its value is substituted when the component is viewed in the preview window. That means you cannot use it in an expression.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.CopyNameMacroVariable
member.summary:
Returns the name of the printed copy.
This variable is actually a macro. Its value is substituted when the component is viewed in the preview window. That means you cannot use it in an expression.

member.name: T:FastReport.Data.Dictionary
member.summary: This class stores all report data items such as datasources, connections, relations, parameters, system variables.
member.remarks: You can access the report dictionary via Report.Dictionary property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Connections
member.summary: Gets a collection of connection objects available in a report.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.DataSources
member.summary: Gets a collection of datasources available in a report.
member.remarks: Usually you don't need to use this property. It contains only datasources registered using the RegisterData method. All other datasources are contained in connection objects and may be accessed via property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Relations
member.summary: Gets a collection of relations.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a collection of parameters.
member.remarks: Another way to access parameters is to use the Report.Parameters property which is actually a shortcut to this property. You also may use the Report.GetParameter and Report.GetParameterValue methods.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.SystemVariables
member.summary: Gets a collection of system variables like Date, PageNofM etc.
member.remarks: Another way to access a system variable is to use the Report.GetVariableValue method.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.Totals
member.summary: Gets a collection of totals.
member.remarks: Another way to get a total value is to use the Report.GetTotalValue method.

member.name: P:FastReport.Data.Dictionary.CubeSources

member.remarks: Usually you don't need to use this property. It contains only cubesources registered using the RegisterData method.

Usually this property is used with the following code block:

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase.Init
member.summary: Initializes this datasource.
member.remarks: This method fills the table with data. You should always call it before using most of datasource properties.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase.Init(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes this datasource and applies the specified filter.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase.Init(System.String,FastReport.SortCollection)
member.summary: Initializes this datasource, applies the specified filter and sorts the rows.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase.Init(FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase)
member.summary: Initializes this datasource and filters data rows according to the master-detail relation between this datasource and parentData.
member.remarks: To use master-detail relation, you must define the object that describes the relation, and add it to the Report.Dictionary.Relations collection.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase.Init(FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase,System.String,FastReport.SortCollection)
member.summary: Initializes this datasource and filters data rows according to the master-detail relation between this datasource and parentData. Also applies the specified filter and sorts the rows.
member.remarks: To use master-detail relation, you must define the object that describes the relation, and add it to the Report.Dictionary.Relations collection.

member.name: M:FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase.Init(FastReport.Data.Relation,System.String,FastReport.SortCollection)
member.summary: Initializes this datasource and filters data rows according to the master-detail relation. Also applies the specified filter and sorts the rows.
member.remarks: To use master-detail relation, you must define the object that describes the relation, and add it to the Report.Dictionary.Relations collection.

member.name: T:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl
member.summary: The base class for all controls that support the data filtering feature.
member.remarks:
The data filtering allows you to bind the control to a . It will be automatically filled by data from the datasource's column. When you select/check item(s) and close the dialog with OK button, it will filter the datasource according to your selection.
You can set the filter operation using the property.

member.name: E:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.DataLoaded
member.summary: Occurs after the control is filled with data.

member.name: P:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.AutoFill
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to fill the control with data automatically.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is true. If you set it to false, you need to call the method manually.

member.name: P:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.AutoFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to filter the datasource automatically when you close the dialog by OK button.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is true. If you set it to false, you need to call the method manually.

member.name: P:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.DataColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a data column name that will be used to fill this control with data.
member.remarks: This property must contain both datasource name and column name, for example: Orders.OrderID. You also may use relations, for example: Orders.Customers.CompanyName.

member.name: P:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.ReportParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets name of report parameter which value will be set to value contained in this control when you close the dialog.

member.name: P:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.FilterOperation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the filter operation.

member.name: P:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.DetailControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the detail control used in cascaded filtering.

member.name: P:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.DataLoadedEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a script method name that will be used to handle the event.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.FillData(FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase,FastReport.Data.Column)
member.summary: Fills the control with data.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.GetListOfData(FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase,FastReport.Data.Column)
member.summary: Returns list of values that can be used to fill control with data.
member.remarks: This method is used by the FillData method to fill list-type controls such as ListBox with data. The result list contains distinct values.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.GetValue
member.summary: Returns value entered in the control.
member.returns: The value of type supported by this control.
member.remarks: This method must return a value entered by the user. For example, TextBox control must return its Text property value. If this control supports multi-selection, return selected values in an array, for example string[] array for CheckedListBox.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.OnFilterChanged
member.summary: Handles the cascaded filter internal logic.
member.remarks: This method should be called in your custom dialog control that supports data filtering. Call it when the value in your control is changed.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.FillData
member.summary: Fills the control with data from a datasource.
member.remarks: Call this method if you set the property to false.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.FillData(FastReport.Data.DataSourceBase)
member.summary: Fills the control with data from a datasource.
member.remarks: Call this method if you need to implement cascaded filter. In the parentData parameter, pass the parent data source that will be used to set up master-detail relationship with data source in this control.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.FillData(FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl)
member.summary: Fills the control with data from a datasource.
member.remarks: Call this method if you need to implement cascaded filter. In the parentControl parameter, pass the parent control which performs filtering on a parent data source.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.FilterData
member.summary: Applies the filter to a datasource.
member.remarks: Call this method if you set the property to false.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.ResetFilter
member.summary: Resets the filter set by this control.

member.name: M:FastReport.Dialog.DataFilterBaseControl.OnDataLoaded(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This method fires the DataLoaded event and the script code connected to the DataLoadedEvent.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DataFilterBaseControl class with default settings.

member.name: T:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align
member.summary: Specifies the alignment methods

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.none
member.summary: Do not force uniform scaling. Scale the graphic content of the given element non-uniformly if necessary such that the element's bounding box exactly matches the viewport rectangle.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMinYMin
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the min-x of the element's viewBox with the smallest X value of the viewport. Align the min-y of the element's viewBox with the smallest Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMidYMin
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the midpoint X value of the element's viewBox with the midpoint X value of the viewport. Align the min-y of the element's viewBox with the smallest Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMaxYMin
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the min-x+width of the element's viewBox with the maximum X value of the viewport. Align the min-y of the element's viewBox with the smallest Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMinYMid
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the min-x of the element's viewBox with the smallest X value of the viewport. Align the midpoint Y value of the element's viewBox with the midpoint Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMidYMid
member.summary: The default. Force uniform scaling. Align the midpoint X value of the element's viewBox with the midpoint X value of the viewport. Align the midpoint Y value of the element's viewBox with the midpoint Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMaxYMid
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the min-x+width of the element's viewBox with the maximum X value of the viewport. Align the midpoint Y value of the element's viewBox with the midpoint Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMinYMax
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the min-x of the element's viewBox with the smallest X value of the viewport. Align the min-y+height of the element's viewBox with the maximum Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMidYMax
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the midpoint X value of the element's viewBox with the midpoint X value of the viewport. Align the min-y+height of the element's viewBox with the maximum Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.Align.xMaxYMax
member.summary: Force uniform scaling. Align the min-x+width of the element's viewBox with the maximum X value of the viewport. Align the min-y+height of the element's viewBox with the maximum Y value of the viewport.

member.name: T:FastReport.Export.Svg.MeetOrSlice
member.summary: Specifies the svg scale types

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.MeetOrSlice.meet
member.summary: (the default) - Scale the graphic such that: - aspect ratio is preserved - the entire viewBox is visible within the viewport - the viewBox is scaled up as much as possible, while still meeting the other criteria

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Svg.MeetOrSlice.slice
member.summary: Scale the graphic such that: - aspect ratio is preserved - the entire viewport is covered by the viewBox - the viewBox is scaled down as much as possible, while still meeting the other criteria

member.name: T:FastReport.Export.Email.EmailExport
member.summary: Represents the email export.
member.remarks: In order to use this class, you need to set up at least the following properties: , , . Use the property to choose the format of an attachment. If you leave it empty, the attachment will be in the .FRP format (FastReport prepared report). When you done with settings, call the method to send an email.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Email.EmailExport.Address
member.summary: Gets or sets the recipient's address.
member.remarks: This property must contain value in form "john@url.com".

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Email.EmailExport.CC
member.summary: Gets or sets the carbon copy adresses.
member.remarks: This property must contain an array of values in form "john@url.com".

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Email.EmailExport.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject of the message.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Email.EmailExport.MessageBody
member.summary: Gets or sets the message body.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Email.EmailExport.Export
member.summary: Gets or sets the export filter which will be used to export a report.
member.remarks:
Set this property to instance of any export filter. When you send the email, the report will be exported using that export filter.
By default, this property is set to null. In this case the report will be send in .FRP format.

member.summary: Gets the email account settings such as host, user name, password.

member.summary: Contains the email account settings such as host, email address, name.
member.remarks:
You have to set up at least the and properties. If your host requires authentication, provide the and properties as well.
Set property to true if you want to use default email client such as Outlook to send an email. In this case, all other properties will be ignored.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.OoXML.Excel2007Export.Wysiwyg
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the wysiwyg mode should be used for better results.
member.remarks: Default value is true. In wysiwyg mode, the resulting Excel file will look as close as possible to the prepared report. On the other side, it may have a lot of small rows/columns, which will make it less editable. If you set this property to false, the number of rows/columns in the resulting file will be decreased. You will get less wysiwyg, but more editable file.

member.name: F:FastReport.Export.Pdf.PDFExport.EmbeddedRelation.Unspecified

member.name: T:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport
member.summary: Represents the RTF export filter.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.JpegQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality of Jpeg images in RTF file.
member.remarks: Default value is 90. This property will be used if you select Jpeg in the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.ImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the image format that will be used to save pictures in RTF file.
member.remarks: Default value is Metafile. This format is better for exporting such objects as MSChartObject and ShapeObject.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.Pictures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that pictures are enabled.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.PageBreaks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that page breaks are enabled.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.Wysiwyg
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the wysiwyg mode should be used for better results.
member.remarks: Default value is true. In wysiwyg mode, the resulting rtf file will look as close as possible to the prepared report. On the other side, it may have a lot of small rows/columns, which will make it less editable. If you set this property to false, the number of rows/columns in the resulting file will be decreased. You will get less wysiwyg, but more editable file.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.Creator
member.summary: Gets or sets the creator of the document.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the rows in the resulting table should calculate its height automatically.
member.remarks: Default value for this property is false. In this mode, each row in the resulting table has fixed height to get maximum wysiwyg. If you set it to true, the height of resulting table will be calculated automatically by the Word processor. The document will be more editable, but less wysiwyg.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.RichText.RTFExport.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the wysiwyg mode should be used for better results.
member.remarks: Default value is true. In wysiwyg mode, the resulting Excel file will look as close as possible to the prepared report. On the other side, it may have a lot of small rows/columns, which will make it less editable. If you set this property to false, the number of rows/columns in the resulting file will be decreased. You will get less wysiwyg, but more editable file.

member.summary: Range of pages to export.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.PageNumbers
member.summary: Page numbers to export.
member.remarks: Use page numbers separated by comma and/or page ranges, for example: "1,3-5,12". Empty string means that all pages need to be exported.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.CurPage
member.summary: Current page number.
member.remarks: Page number need to be exported if user selects "Current page" radiobutton in the export options dialog. This property is typically set to current page number in the preview window.

member.summary: Open the document after export.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating that the export may produce multiple output files.

member.summary: This method is called when the export starts.

member.param: Page for export may be empty in this method.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.ExportPageEnd(FastReport.ReportPage)

member.param: Page for export may be empty in this method.

member.summary: This method is called for each band on exported page.

member.summary: This method is called when the export is finished.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.GetOverlayPage(FastReport.ReportPage)

member.returns: The prepared report page with OverlayBand.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.GetPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a report page with specified index.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.ShowDialog
member.summary: Displays a dialog with export options.
member.returns: true if dialog was closed with OK button.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.Export(FastReport.Report,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Exports the report to a stream.
member.remarks: This method does not show an export options dialog. If you want to show it, call method prior to calling this method, or use the "Export(Report report)" method instead.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.Export(FastReport.Report,System.String)
member.summary: Exports the report to a file.
member.remarks: This method does not show an export options dialog. If you want to show it, call method prior to calling this method, or use the "Export(Report report)" method instead.

member.name: M:FastReport.Export.ExportBase.Export(FastReport.Report)
member.summary: Exports the report to a file.
member.returns: true if report was succesfully exported.
member.remarks: This method displays an export options dialog, then prompts a file name using standard "Open file" dialog. If both dialogs were closed by OK button, exports the report and returns true.

member.summary: Specifies the .emf format.

member.name: T:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport
member.summary: Represents the image export filter.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.ImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the image format.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.SeparateFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to generate separate image file for each exported page.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, the export filter will produce one big image containing all exported pages. Be careful using this property with a big report because it may produce out of memory error.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets image resolution, in dpi.
member.remarks: By default this property is set to 96 dpi. Use bigger values (300-600 dpi) if you going to print the exported images.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.ResolutionX
member.summary: Gets or sets horizontal image resolution, in dpi.
member.remarks: Separate horizontal and vertical resolution is used when exporting to TIFF. In other cases, use the property instead.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.ResolutionY
member.summary: Gets or sets vertical image resolution, in dpi.
member.remarks: Separate horizontal and vertical resolution is used when exporting to TIFF. In other cases, use the property instead.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.JpegQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the jpg image quality.
member.remarks: This property is used if is set to Jpeg. By default it is set to 100. Use lesser value to decrease the jpg file size.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.MultiFrameTiff
member.summary: Gets or sets the value determines whether to produce multi-frame tiff file.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.MonochromeTiff
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the Tiff export must produce monochrome image.
member.remarks: Monochrome tiff image is compressed using the compression method specified in the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.MonochromeTiffCompression
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression method for a monochrome TIFF image.
member.remarks:
This property is used only when exporting to TIFF image, and the property is set to true.
The valid values for this property are: EncoderValue.CompressionNone, EncoderValue.CompressionLZW, EncoderValue.CompressionRle, EncoderValue.CompressionCCITT3, EncoderValue.CompressionCCITT4. The default compression method is CCITT4.

member.name: P:FastReport.Export.Image.ImageExport.PaddingNonSeparatePages
member.summary: Sets padding in non separate pages

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: E:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject.ManualBuild
member.summary: Allows to fill the matrix in code.
member.remarks:
In most cases the matrix is connected to a datasource via the property. When you run a report, the matrix is filled with datasource values automatically.
Using this event, you can put additional values to the matrix or even completely fill it with own values (if is set to null. To do this, call the Data.AddValue method. See the method for more details.

member.name: M:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixObject.Value(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of the data cell with the specified index.
member.param: Zero-based index of the data cell.
member.remarks:
Use this method in the cell's expression if the cell has custom totals (the total function is set to "Custom"). The example:
Matrix1.Value(0) / Matrix1.Value(1)
will return the result of dividing the first data cell's value by the second one.

member.name: T:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData
member.summary: Contains a set of properties and methods to hold and manipulate the matrix descriptors.
member.remarks:
This class contains three collections of descriptors such as , and . Use collections' methods to add/remove descriptors. When you are done, call the method to refresh the matrix.
To fill a matrix in code, use the AddValue method.

member.summary: Gets a collection of column descriptors.
member.remarks: Note: after you change something in this collection, call the method to refresh the matrix.

member.summary: Gets a collection of row descriptors.
member.remarks: Note: after you change something in this collection, call the method to refresh the matrix.

member.summary: Gets a collection of data cell descriptors.
member.remarks: Note: after you change something in this collection, call the method to refresh the matrix.

member.summary: Clears all descriptors.

member.name: M:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixData.AddValue(System.Object[],System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Adds a value in the matrix.
member.remarks: The number of elements in an array passed to this method must be the same as a number of descriptors in the appropriate collection. That is, if your matrix has one column, two row and one cell descriptors (in Columns, Rows and Cells collections respectively), you have to pass one-element array for the columnValues param, two-element array for the rowValues and one-element array for the cellValues.

member.remarks: See the method for more details.

member.name: T:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor
member.summary: The descriptor that is used to describe one element of the matrix header.
member.remarks:
The class is used to define one header element of the matrix (either the column element or row element). The key properties are , and .
To set visual appearance of the element, use the property. To set visual appearance of the "total" element, use the property.
The collection of descriptors used to represent the matrix header is stored in the MatrixObject.Data.Columns and MatrixObject.Data.Rows properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.Sort
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort order of header values.
member.remarks: This property determines how the values displayed in this element are sorted. The default sort is ascending.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.Totals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that this element has associated "total" element.
member.remarks: To access the matrix cell that is bound to the "Total" element, use the property. It may be useful to change the "Total" text by something else.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.TotalsFirst
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the total values must be printed before the data.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.PageBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the page break must be printed before this element.
member.remarks: Page break is not printed before the very first element.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.SuppressTotals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether it is necessary to suppress totals if there is only one value in a group.

member.name: P:FastReport.Matrix.MatrixHeaderDescriptor.TemplateTotalColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets the template column bound to the "total" element of this descriptor.
member.remarks: This property is for internal use; usually you don't need to use it.

member.name: T:FastReport.MSChart.MSChartObject
member.summary: Represents the chart object based on Microsoft Chart control.
member.remarks:
FastReport uses Microsoft Chart library to display charts. This library is included in .Net Framework 4.0. For .Net 3.5 it is available as a separate download here: http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=130f7986-bf49-4fe5-9ca8-910ae6ea442c
This library requires .Net Framework 3.5 SP1.
To access Microsoft Chart object, use the property. It allows you to set up chart appearance. For more information on available properties, refer to the MS Chart documentation.
Chart object may contain one or several series. Each series is represented by two objects:
the Series that is handled by MS Chart. It is stored in the Chart.Series collection;
the object that provides data for MS Chart series. It is stored in the collection.
Do not operate series objects directly. To add or remove series, use the and methods. These methods handle Series and MSChartSeries in sync.
If you have a chart object on your Form and want to print it in FastReport, use the method.
