member.name: T:FastReport.Duplicates
member.summary: Specifies how to display the duplicate values.

member.name: F:FastReport.Duplicates.Show
member.summary: The TextObject can show duplicate values.

member.name: F:FastReport.Duplicates.Hide
member.summary: The TextObject with duplicate value will be hidden.

member.name: F:FastReport.Duplicates.Clear
member.summary: The TextObject with duplicate value will be shown but with no text.

member.name: F:FastReport.Duplicates.Merge
member.summary: Several TextObject objects with the same value will be merged into one TextObject object.

member.name: T:FastReport.ProcessAt
member.summary: Specifies how the report engine processes the text objects.

member.name: F:FastReport.ProcessAt.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default process mode. The text object is processed just-in-time.

member.name: F:FastReport.ProcessAt.ReportFinished
member.summary: Specifies that the text object must be processed when the entire report is finished. This mode can be used to print grand total value (which is normally calculated at the end of report) in the report title band.

member.name: F:FastReport.ProcessAt.ReportPageFinished
member.summary: Specifies that the text object must be processed when the entire report page is finished. This mode can be used if the report template consists of several report pages.

member.name: F:FastReport.ProcessAt.PageFinished
member.summary: Specifies that the text object must be processed when any report page is finished. This mode can be used to print the page total (which is normally calculated at the page footer) in the page header band.

member.name: F:FastReport.ProcessAt.ColumnFinished
member.summary: Specifies that the text object must be processed when the column is finished. This mode can be used to print the column total (which is normally calculated at the column footer) in the column header band.

member.name: F:FastReport.ProcessAt.DataFinished
member.summary: Specifies that the text object must be processed when the data block is finished. This mode can be used to print a total value in the data header (which is normally available in the data footer only).

member.name: F:FastReport.ProcessAt.GroupFinished

member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to another similar object that will be used for displaying the text that not fit in this object.

member.name: M:FastReport.BreakableComponent.Break(FastReport.BreakableComponent)
member.summary: Breaks the contents of the object.
member.param: Object to put the part of content to that does not fit in this object. These two objects must have the same type.
member.returns: true if there is enough space in this object to display at least one text line.

remarks.para: Do not call this method directly, it is used by the report engine. You should override it if you are writing a new FastReport object.

This method must break the contents of the object. The part of content that fit in current object's bounds should remain in this object, the part that does not fit should be transferred to breakTo object.

member.name: T:FastReport.SmartTagBase
member.summary: The base class for smart tags.

remarks.para: "Smart tag" is a little button that appears near the object's top-right corner when we are in the designer and move the mouse over the object. When you click that button you will see a popup window where you can set up some properties of the object. FastReport uses smart tags to quickly choose the datasource (for a band) or data column (for objects).
Smart tag is internally a ContextMenuStrip.

member.name: T:FastReport.Border
member.summary: Represents a border around the report object.
member.remarks:
Border consists of four lines. Each line has own color, style and width. Lines are accessible through , , , properties.
To turn on and off the lines, use the property. To set the same color, style or width for each line, use , , properties of the Border.

member.name: T:FastReport.PrintMode
member.summary: Specifies the report printing mode.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default printing mode. One report page produces one printed paper sheet of the same size.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintMode.Split
member.summary: Specifies the split mode. Big report page produces several smaller paper sheets. Use this mode to print A3 report on A4 printer.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintMode.Scale
member.summary: Specifies the scale mode. One or several report pages produce one bigger paper sheet. Use this mode to print A5 report on A4 printer.

member.name: T:FastReport.PagesOnSheet
member.summary: Specifies the number of report pages printed on one paper sheet.

member.name: F:FastReport.PagesOnSheet.One
member.summary: Specifies one report page per sheet.

member.name: F:FastReport.PagesOnSheet.Two
member.summary: Specifies two report pages per sheet.

member.name: F:FastReport.PagesOnSheet.Four
member.summary: Specifies four report pages per sheet.

member.name: F:FastReport.PagesOnSheet.Eight
member.summary: Specifies eight report pages per sheet.

member.name: T:FastReport.PrintPages
member.summary: Specifies the pages to print.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintPages.All
member.summary: Print all report pages.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintPages.Odd
member.summary: Print odd pages only.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintPages.Even
member.summary: Print even pages only.

member.name: T:FastReport.PrintSettings
member.summary: This class contains the printer settings. It is used in the property.
member.remarks: Typical use of this class is to setup a printer properties without using the "Print" dialog. In this case, setup necessary properties and turn off the dialog via the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.Printer
member.summary: Gets or sets the printer name.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.SavePrinterWithReport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the printer name should be saved in a report file.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, the printer name will be saved in a report file. Next time when you open the report, the printer will be automatically selected.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PrintToFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that the printing output should be send to a file instead of a printer.
member.remarks: Also set the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PrintToFileName
member.summary: The name of a file to print the report to.
member.remarks: This property is used if property is true.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PageRange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifies the page range to print.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PageNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number(s) to print.
member.remarks: This property is used if property is set to PageNumbers. You can specify the page numbers, separated by commas, or the page ranges. For example: "1,3,5-12".

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.Copies
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of copies to print.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.Collate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the printed document should be collated.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PrintPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifies the pages to print.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.Reverse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determines whether to print pages in reverse order.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.Duplex
member.summary: Gets or sets the duplex mode.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PaperSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the paper source.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the RAW source number. Default value is 7 which corresponds to DMBIN_AUTO.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PrintMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the print mode.
member.remarks: See the enumeration for details. If you use the mode other than Default, you must specify the sheet size in the , properties.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PrintOnSheetWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the paper sheet to print on.
member.remarks: This property is used if the property is not Default. Specify the paper width in millimeters.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PrintOnSheetHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the paper sheet to print on.
member.remarks: This property is used if the property is not Default. Specify the paper height in millimeters.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PrintOnSheetRawPaperSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw index of a paper size.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.PagesOnSheet
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages per printed sheet.
member.remarks: This property is used if the property is set to Scale.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.CopyNames
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of printed copy names, such as "Original", "Copy", etc.

member.name: P:FastReport.PrintSettings.ShowDialog
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the "Print" dialog.

member.name: M:FastReport.PrintSettings.Assign(FastReport.PrintSettings)
member.summary: Assigns values from another source.

member.summary: Resets all settings to its default values.

member.name: M:FastReport.PrintSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default settings.

member.name: T:FastReport.ShiftMode
member.summary: The automatic shift mode.

member.name: F:FastReport.ShiftMode.Never
member.summary: Do not shift the object.

member.name: F:FastReport.ShiftMode.Always
member.summary: Shift the object up or down if any object above it shrinks or grows.

member.name: F:FastReport.ShiftMode.WhenOverlapped
member.summary: Shift the object up or down if any object above it shrinks or grows. Objects must have overlapped x-coordinates.

member.name: T:FastReport.PrintOn
member.summary: Specifies where to print an object.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintOn.None
member.summary: Do not print the object.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintOn.FirstPage
member.summary: Print the object on the first page. If this flag is not set, the object will not be printed on the first page.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintOn.LastPage
member.summary: Print the object on the last page. If this flag is not set, the object will not be printed on the last page. You should set the report's double pass option to make it work correctly.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintOn.OddPages
member.summary: Print the object on odd pages only.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintOn.EvenPages
member.summary: Print the object on even pages only.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintOn.RepeatedBand
member.summary: Print the object on band with "Repeat on Every Page" flag when that band is repeated.

member.name: F:FastReport.PrintOn.SinglePage
member.summary: Print the object if the report has single page only.

member.name: T:FastReport.Variant
member.summary: A strongly typed object that readily casts an intrinsic object to the other intrinsic types when possible.

remarks.para: The Variant class is an intrinsic object container structure inspired by Visual Basic 6.0's Variant. The key features of a Variant class include the ability to perform typecasts and arithmetic between types that are not normally considered compatible. For example, if a Variant class contains a string describing a number, such as "1.1", then floating point arithmetic can be performed on it.

Variants are normally considered dangerous because they strip away the effectiveness of type safety, which is the reason why the Visual Basic 6.0 Variant was left out of Visual Basic .NET. However, this implementation restores the Variant structure, both as a proof of concept and as a restoration of the utility and positive merits of the Variant where it can be used responsibly.

member.name: M:FastReport.Variant.op_Addition(FastReport.Variant,System.Object)
member.summary: Addition operator.
member.remarks: If the value on the right is a or a , the Variant is converted to a string and appended. If the value on the right or the Variant is a , arithmetic is performed on the property and the resulting value is set to the DateTime type. Otherwise, if the value on the right is a number, both the Variant and the value on the right are converted to a , the arithmetic is performed, and the resulting value is converted back to the original type that the Variant previously represented. If the type that the Variant previously represented cannot contain the resulting value--such as if the type is a and the value is -12--then the type will be converted to a type that can contain the value, such as .
member.returns: A new containing the resulting value.

member.name: M:FastReport.Variant.CBln(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object to a boolean. For any type, if null, returns false. For Boolean: true/false. For String: "", "false", "0", etc. == false; "1", "true", etc. == true, else true. For numeric intrinsics: 0 == false, else true. For any other non-null object, returns true.
member.returns: The boolean value of this string.

member.name: T:FastReport.Watermark

member.remarks: Watermark can draw text and/or image behind the page objects on in front of them. To enable watermark, set its Enabled property to true.
